parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Operations mode
parameter.description:
Parameter defines device operation mode

Overview

Available settings:

0 - Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor
1 - external button

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Door/Window or alarm status
parameter.description:
Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If the alarm sensor is connected, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Overview

Available settings:

0 - Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor
1 - external button

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Visual LED indications
parameter.description:
This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - no indications
1 - indication of opening/closing status change
(input IN)
2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical)
4 - indication of device tampering

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Range test after double click
parameter.description:
Allows to enable activation of Z-Wave range test with double click of a TMP button.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - disabled
1 - enabled

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: 2nd association group triggers
parameter.description:
Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is i

Overview

Available settings:

0 - switch after opening and closing
1 - switch after opening
2 - switch after closing

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Commands sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description:
Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - ON
1 - OFF
2 - ON & OFF

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level

parameter.name: config_14_2
parameter.label: 14: Time delay of ON command frame
parameter.description: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

parameter.name: config_15_2
parameter.label: 15: Time delay of OFF command frame
parameter.description: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Type of sent alarm frames
parameter.description:
Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group “Alarm”. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - Door/Window Sensor (General Purpose Alarm)
1 - smoke sensor (Smoke Alarm)
2 - CO detector (CO Alarm)
3 - CO2 detector (CO2 Alarm)
4 - high temperature sensor (Heat Alarm)
5 - flood sensor (Water Alarm)

parameter.name: config_30_2
parameter.label: 30: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
parameter.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
parameter.description:
Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th association group.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - do not send tamper cancellation report
1 - send tamper cancellation report

parameter.name: config_50_2
parameter.label: 50: Interval of temperature measurements
parameter.description:
This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - temperature measurements disabled
5-32400 - time in seconds

parameter.name: config_51_2
parameter.label: 51: Temperature reports threshold
parameter.description:
This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled
1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30°C, 0.1°C step)

parameter.name: config_52_2
parameter.label: 52: Interval of temperature reports
parameter.description:
This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - periodic temperature reports disabled
5-32400 - time in seconds

parameter.name: config_53_4
parameter.label: 53: Temperature offset
parameter.description:
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).

Overview

Available settings:

-1000-1000 (-100-100°C, 0.1°C step)

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: Temperature alarm reports
parameter.description:
Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - temperature alarms disabled
1 - high temperature alarm
2 - low temperature alarm
3 - high and low temperature alarms enabled

parameter.name: config_55_2
parameter.label: 55: High temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description:
If temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).

Overview

Available settings:

0-1000 (0-100°C, 0.1°C step)

parameter.name: config_56_2
parameter.label: 56: Low temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description:
If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).

Overview

Available settings:

-300-700 (-30-70°C, 0.1°C step)

parameter.name: config_70_2
parameter.label: 70: Scene activation functionality
parameter.description:
The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903.

Overview

Available settings:

1 - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click)
2 - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click)
4 - [ID 12] holding
8 - [ID 13] releasing
16 - [ID 14] double click
32 - [ID 15] triple click
256 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window
opened
512 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window
closed
1024 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window
opened
2048 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window
closed

parameter.name: config_71_1
parameter.label: 71: Alarm broadcast
parameter.description:
Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - broadcasts inactive
1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active
2 - sensor alarm broadcast active
4 - tamper alarm broadcast active

parameter.name: config_72_1
parameter.label: 72: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
parameter.description:
This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group “Lifeline”.

Overview

Available settings:

0 - none of the groups sent as secure
1 - 2nd group ”Control” sent as secure
2 - 3rd group ”Alarm” sent as secure
4 - 4th group “Sensor ZW3” sent as secure
8 - 5th group “Tamper ZW3” sent as secure

15 - (all)
